data.title: [Documentation] Instructions for building for Android contradictory.
data.body:
Hi,

The instructions on [compiling for Android](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/compiling_android) have some confusing/wrong information:

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

```
C:\godot> copy bin/libgodot_android.debug.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/libgodot_android.so

alternatively if you are under unix you can symlink:

user@host:~/godot$ ln -s platform/android/libgodot_android.debug.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/libgodot_android.so
```

Should probably read:

```
C:\godot> copy platform/android/bin/libgodot.android.debug.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/libgodot_android.so

alternatively if you are under unix you can symlink:

user@host:~/godot$ ln -s platform/android/bin/libgodot.android.debug.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi/libgodot_android.so
```

Changes:
- The source file is actually called `libgodot.android.debug.so`, with a dot instead of an underscore.
- In both cases it is probably found in `platform/android/bin/`, or `bin/`, not `platform/android/`. Or does it differ, depending on the OS?

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

But the section after that, about building the templates, contradicts the whole thing:

```
C:\godot> cp bin/libgodot_android.opt.debug.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi
```

and

```
C:\godot> cp bin/libgodot_android.opt.so platform/android/java/libs/armeabi
```

Apart from also using `bin/` and the underscore in the source path, in both cases, there is the additional `opt` or `debug` part, and the target path does not rename it. I wonder:
- Does this mean that there are now three files in the `armeabi` directory?
- If this creates the templates, then what does the above section (with the `libgodot_android.so`) create?
- If I run `ant debug`, which of those three libraries does it use? What if I run `ant release`?
- Which of those libraries will it include in the template APKs? All three? (My self-generated templates are huge, compared to the templates from your website.)
- What did I do wrong, to have the Pong example result in ~180MB (!!) when installed on Android.

Because I just tried to write a small build script to rebuild everything after a git pull, and I can’t tell what’s the correct procedure.

If you could improve that wiki page, I would be soo happy. :)

data.title: sprite_3d.cpp: fixed buffer access out of bounds.
Fixed buffer access out of bounds.
canvas_draw_polygon cannot work under android platform
data.body:
I was written spine support for godog eninge, codes is fully write completed, and it's work correct under windows platform, but can't draw anything under android platform, this is a problem in RasterizerGLES2::canvas_draw_polygon API.

then i writed some test scripts:

```
class Shape extends Node2D:
    var vertices

    func _init(vertices):
        self.vertices = vertices

    func _draw():
        draw_colored_polygon(self.vertices, Color(0,0.6,0.7,0.5))
        draw_circle(Vector2(0, 0), 100, Color(0, 1, 0, 0.5))
```

these code draw correct under windows platform, but cannot draw anything under android platform...

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6880378/5486748/26745d9c-86e5-11e4-8cbc-b62bb91490ad.png)

How to fix this problem??? please help me.

data.title: Ignore unrecognized parameters from the command line
data.body:
Drop any unrecognized option from the command line showing them in the console instead.
This avoids crashing Godot.app when running from Xcode, since Xcode passes the parameters "-NSDocumentRevisionsDebugMode YES" in the command line.

data.title: Complete the documentation of all script classes & functions of 1.0 before adding features.
data.body:
I’ve seen many functions whose functionality, input and output parameters are not explained. Even whole classes. (Like SceneTree.)

Also certain things do not turn up in the code completion, even though they are documented.

So in terms of being usable, there’s no point in adding new features, if the old ones can’t even be used properly due to lacking documentation.

That’s why I really hope you complete the documentation as a high priority. (Preferably by having the code documented, and generating the wiki pages (and code completion data) from that.
(Showing short descriptions of the functionality and parameters right in the code completion would of course be even cooler.)

I also hope bug can serve as a marker for complete documentation of everything up to the 1.0 release. 

Thank you. :)

data.title: tutorial_vector_math: A much better explanation of the dot product.
data.body:
Hi, the section says the dot product is hard to understand and makes no sense.
But I’ve found a really nice and intuitive way to think about it:

> The dot product simply is the indicator for how much two vectors have in common.
> The bigger, in relation to their magnitudes, the more two vectors have in common.
> Simple. :)

I think that it’s hard / makes no sense is a false meme,
and it’s just the explanation we learned it from that has always been bad,
which instilled fear, and _caused_ us to have trouble understanding it _in the first place_.

So I hope you can add the above explanation,
and remove the lines about it being hard or making no sense. :)

data.title: Fix crash when gd-script _init fail
Selected node(s) can now be moved up and down in scene tree dock.
data.body: Seems to work error-free. Tested with different scenarios. Closes #965 feature request.

data.title: change shortcut for toggle-comment to Ctrl+K
data.body:
change shortcut for toggle-comment to Ctrl+K
Ctrl+/ is not standard, doesn't work on eg: German keyboards.
Ctrl+K was already used for commenting lines, so I just replaced it with the newer, better, toggle function.

data.title: xml_parser: check array length index before accessing the array.
data.body: Defensive programming: The variable `i` is used as an array index before it is checked that is within limits. This can mean that the array might be accessed out of bounds. Reorder conditions such as `(a[i] && i < 10)` to `(i < 10 && a[i])`. That way the array will not be accessed if the index is out of limits.

data.title: Manitaining Changelogs
data.body:
Hi

Can we start maintaining change logs for each release?

Also it will be nice if we start to organize the issues in the tracker by milestone. It gets difficult to follow the project otherwise.

thanks
RS

data.title: Support for RTL input and display
data.body: The editor doesn't recognize the non-latin characters (it writes nothing) even with changing the font of the editor. Also trying to paste a word of non-latin will print the Unicode representation (e.g. \u2320\u3433...etc) not the real word (e.g. سلام).

data.title: Removed duplicated code
data.body: The code in the if-branches always made the same, so I guess it increases the readability a bit when it's moved on top.

data.title: fix demo 3d mousepick test
data.body:
add the missing camera parameter to the _input_event()

it is related to issue #938

data.title: Assigning a new value to a euler after fetching it crashes Godot
data.body:
So let's say you have this in your code

```
var trans = get_global_transform()
var base = trans.basis
var euler = base.get_euler()
euler[2] = 1
```

The addition of the last line will cause the game to crash 100 percent of the time, the idea was that I would use that to directly set an object's global rotation, if only the code could work.

If you can take a look at it, that would be good.

Thanks.

data.title: Insert Key always inserts Rot
data.body: The handy Insert Keys button at the top of the editor (or pressing the Insert key on the keyboard) when editing an animation will always insert rotation keyframes, even if the "rot" button is not selected. It should only be inserting keyframes for the selected options. The loc (position) and scl (scale) buttons seem to behave correctly.

data.title: usability: more logical ordering of animation buttons
data.body:
This is a small change. All this does is moves the Delete Animation and Rename Animation options to the left side, with the New, Load, Duplicate buttons. The right side retains the AutoPlay, Blend Times, and Edit Animation buttons. This gives a more logical ordering / grouping of operations.

This also helps differentiate between the Blend and Delete buttons, which look somewhat similar and, currently being right beside each other, can easily be confused, especially at higher resolutions.

It also helps avoid confusing the Delete Animation and Delete Track buttons, which I personally have done many, many times.

data.title: duplicating an animation doesn't copy next auto-queue
data.body:
If you duplicate an animation, the copy should copy everything, including the next auto-queue (in Blend dialog)

also, would be nice if the next auto-queue option was a dropdown menu instead of a text box, unless there's a reason we would want a text box?

data.title: Invalid call. Unexisting function 'set_input_as_handled' in base 'GDNativeClass'
data.body:
Hi,

Godot RC2, win64.
I was studying tutorial about input and events. So I wrote this :

```
func _input(event):
if event.type == InputEvent.KEY :
    # do something
    SceneTree.set_input_as_handled()
```

When I run, it stops and the editor write this in orange :

**Invalid call. Unexisting function 'set_input_as_handled' in base 'GDNativeClass'**

Edit : maybe it is only available for the C++ API ??

data.title: No alpha in RenderTargetTextures
data.body:
It seems alpha is not displayed when using RenderTargetTextures.

How to reproduce:
Take the viewport/gui_in_3d demo.
Change the StyleBoxTexture of the Panel (gui) to a texture which has bigger rounded corners than the default.
Optionally add some objects behind the quad to make the lack of alpha more apparent.
The result would look something like this:
![](http://www.michavk.dds.nl/pub/ONTBIL7Es2ItRjTuKtdh/godot_alpha_issue_run_.jpg)

data.title: [minor request] CTRL+D to duplicate a line into the Script Editor
data.body:
Hi,

When editing a script into the editor, Ctrl+D is still assigned to the _<somewhere else>_ where it duplicates nodes.

It would be cool if it was assigned to a _duplicate-line_ function when editing a script.

data.title: String.trim() String.left_trim() String.right_trim()
data.body:
Hi,

This is a minor request. I missed those methods into the String API : trim(), left_trim(), right_trim() to remove white space around the string.

data.body:
I'm willing to develop game for android. Can I take picture with phone camera with godot engine? If can't, how to access android API via godot engine?

Thanks
